mva2.adapter.decorator

Annotation Type PositionType


  • @Retention(value=SOURCE)
public @interface PositionType
    PositionType refers to relative position of item in the RecyclerView.LayoutManager.

    PositionType is an int value, which is the result of binary 'OR' function. If the item is first element in a GridLayoutManager, then the item will be on the top and left edge. So the positionTYpe for that item is (LEFT | TOP)

    Though PositionType can be used independently, it is advised to use it with Decorator.

    You can use Decorator to resolve the position type into more useful information. The Decorator will return whether the item lies on the particular edge. Example Usage : 

     
 boolean isOnTopEdge = Decorator.isItemOnTopEdge(positionType);
    See Also:
    Decorator

    • Field Detail

      • LEFT

        public static final int LEFT
        Denotes that the item/section is lies in the left edge

      • TOP

        public static final int TOP
        Denotes that the item/section is lies in the top edge

      • RIGHT

        public static final int RIGHT
        Denotes that the item/section lies in the right edge

      • BOTTOM

        public static final int BOTTOM
        Denotes that the item/section lies in the bottom edge

      • MIDDLE

        public static final int MIDDLE
        Denotes that the item/section lies in the middle
